newsitem.title: SLOVENIA: Slovenian shares tumble on NATO shut-out.
newsitem.headline: Slovenian shares tumble on NATO shut-out.

text.p: Slovenian shares fell 2.95 percent on Monday extending their losses to a total 6.7 percent since the United States said on Thursday they would not back Slovenia's candidacy to join NATO in 1999.

"Remaining outside of NATO means that international capital will stay away from Slovenia for a longer period than it would otherwise therefore liquidity will remain poor and will thus push prices down," a trader said.
Analysts said the index could fall another 10 percent by the end of August as market liquidity usually dries up during the summer.
* The blue-chip SBI index fell 36.44 points to 1,199.16.

* Petrol trader Petrol was the most actively traded, closing 0.63 percent higher at 16,100 tolars on volume of 913 shares. Traders attributed the rise to a technical rebound after Petrol fell 4.5 percent last week. -- Ljubljana newsroom, 386-61-125-8439
